New Records: Aaron Judge hit a two-run home run and a sacrifice fly, contributing significantly to the Yankees' victory. The Yankees' bullpen combined for 3 2/3 scoreless innings, a team record in the postseason. José Ramírez hit a ninth-inning home run, marking only the second earned run allowed by the Yankees' bullpen in 23 1/3 innings over six postseason games.
Key Match Events: Aaron Judge's two-run drive into Monument Park and sacrifice fly in the second inning were pivotal moments. The Guardians' defensive errors, including Brayan Rocchio dropping a popup and Will Brennan bobbled pickup, led to key runs. Gerrit Cole escaped a bases-loaded, one-out jam in the fourth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: The Yankees secured a 2-0 ALCS lead for the first time since 2009 against the Los Angeles Angels. The game was followed by a day off, with Game 3 set for Thursday in Cleveland.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Steven Kwan extended his Cleveland-record postseason hitting streak to 12 games. New York's Gleyber Torres reached base leading off for the fifth time in the playoffs with three hits, while Anthony Rizzo had two hits and was 3-for-7 in two games since returning from a pair of fractured fingers.
Others: Cleveland went 0-for-7 with runners in scoring position and stranded 11 runners. The Guardians replaced RHP Alex Cobb with RHP Ben Lively due to a lower back strain. Yankees RHP Clarke Schmidt will start Game 3 in Cleveland.
